case_data.name: Gagnon v. Shumway
case_data.plaintiff_description: All persons whose conditional discharge from New Hampshire mental health facilities had been absolutely revoked and who, as a result, were involuntarily confined or would be involuntarily confined without the opportunity to consult with or be represented by counsel.
settlement_agreement: Court Approved Settlement or Consent Decree
case_data.summary:
This class-action case was filed in the U.S. District Court for the District of New Hampshire on May 8, 1998. The plaintiffs contested the constitutionality of a state statute, and its implementing regulations, which they argued allowed the State to revoke without due process "conditional discharges" from involuntary confinement for mental health issues.

The Court (Judge Steven J. McAuliffe) issued an order certifying the class on August 31, 1999. The class was defined to include "all persons whose conditional discharge [had] been absolutely revoked and who, as a result..., [were] involuntarily confined or [would be] involuntarily confined to ... a designated receiving facility without a hearing or the opportunity to consult with or be represented by counsel." 1999 WL 813953, Gagnon v. Commissioner (D. N.H. 1999).

On April 10, 2000, the parties submitted a proposed Class Action Settlement Agreement, which the court approved on July 24, 2000. In the settlement, the State agreed to appoint counsel whenever a conditional discharge was revoked.

The case appears to be closed, and no further information is available.
case_data.summary_short: This class-action case was filed in the U.S. District Court for the District of New Hampshire on May 8, 1998. The plaintiffs contested the constitutionality of a state statute, and its implementing regulations, which they argued allowed the State to revoke without due process "conditional discharges" from involuntary confinement for mental health issues. On July 24, 2000, the Court approved a settlement wherein the State agreed to appoint counsel whenever a conditional discharge was revoked.
